Package de.oth.blocklib.helper.collider

Class TerrainCollisionReactions

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.helper.collider.TerrainCollisionReactions
public class TerrainCollisionReactions
extends java.lang.Object
A class that provides static methods, which represent different reactions for colliding objects.
Author:
Tobias Mueller

  • Method Details

    • destroyTerrain

      public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f destroyTerrain​(TerrainCollisionData data, FlyingRock r, int maxParticleAmount)
      A method that can be called, if a FlyingRock should punch a hole into the world.
      Parameters:
      data - the TerrainCollisionData of the collision
      r - the reference to the colliding FlyingRock
      maxParticleAmount - the maximum amount of additional FlyingRocks that should be created.

    • shatter

      public static void shatter​(TerrainCollisionData data, FlyingRock rock)
      A method that can be called, if a moving rock should shatter into smaller rocks upon collision
      Parameters:
      data - An array of all terrain collisions that occur in this frame
      rock - the velocity of the colliding object

    • bounce

      public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f bounce​(TerrainCollisionData data, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f velocity, float bounciness)
      A method that can be called, if a moving object should bounce off the world
      Parameters:
      data - An array of all terrain collisions that occur in this frame
      velocity - the velocity of the colliding object
      bounciness - determines the loss of speed when colliding. 1 : no speed is lost, 0 : don't bounce at all
      Returns:
      the velocity of the colliding object after the collision happened

    • split

      public static java.util.ArrayList<FlyingRock> split​(FlyingRock flyingRock)

    • buildSubModel

      private static void buildSubModel​(short[][][] modelOrigin, short[][][] model, int startX, int startY, int startZ)
